In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code to solve your problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `ym`. The values in this new column are calculated by mapping over the `:dt` column, extracting the year and month from each DateTime value, and concatenating them into an integer.

You can use it like this:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates
df = DataFrame(dt = [DateTime(2021, 1, 1), DateTime(2022, 2, 29), DateTime(2023, 3, 31)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will return a new DataFrame with an additional column `ym` that contains the year and month of each date in the format "yyyymm".
